terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: These terms govern access to the Asso platform and outline the respective responsibilities of associations and the publisher.

content.p1: The Asso service is intended for non-profit organizations that need to manage bookkeeping and members.
content.p2: Using the platform implies full acceptance of these terms and of all related policies.
content.p3: Features may evolve to comply with regulations and to meet customer expectations.

content.p1: The organization administrator is responsible for the accuracy of the information provided during onboarding.
content.p2: Each user keeps their credentials confidential and reports any suspicious activity without delay.
content.p3: Access may be suspended if legal or contractual obligations are breached.

content.p1: Asso provides accounting, member management, grant tracking and regulatory reporting modules.
content.p2: The service is available around the clock. Scheduled maintenance is announced at least 48 hours in advance.
content.p3: Daily backups are performed to guarantee service continuity and data integrity.

content.p1: Associations remain responsible for the accuracy of the data they enter and for complying with statutory requirements.
content.p2: The publisher implements appropriate security measures and informs the customer about relevant incidents.
content.p3: Indirect damages or lost profits cannot be claimed from the publisher.

content.p1: Questions can be sent to support@asso.example or via the in-app documentation hub.

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.description: This policy explains how Asso processes personal data on behalf of customer organizations.

content.p1: Identification, billing and accounting data are collected to deliver the contracted services.
content.p2: Audit logs are retained for three years to preserve the traceability of sensitive operations.

content.p1: Data is used to execute the contract, fulfil legal obligations and continuously improve the platform.
content.p2: Data is never sold. Sub-processors operate under GDPR-compliant agreements.

content.p1: Members can exercise their access, rectification, objection and deletion rights through their association or directly with the publisher.
content.p2: Requests are handled within 30 days and tracked in a GDPR request register.

content.p1: Data is hosted in the European Union with encrypted backups and strict access control.
content.p2: Information is retained for the duration of the contract plus any statutory retention period.

content.p1: Inquiries can be addressed to privacy@asso.example or the Data Protection Officer.

dpa.title: Data Processing Agreement
dpa.description: This agreement defines the obligations of the controller (the association) and the processor (Asso).

content.p1: The agreement governs the processing activities carried out by Asso on behalf of the association in line with GDPR.
content.p2: It applies for the duration of the contract and during the data handover phase.

content.p1: Asso only processes personal data based on documented instructions from the association.
content.p2: Any request that conflicts with applicable law is escalated to the controller without delay.

content.p1: Appropriate technical and organizational measures prevent accidental destruction, loss or disclosure.
content.p2: Access is restricted to authorized personnel and is comprehensively logged.

content.p1: The association is informed of any additional sub-processor and can raise documented objections.
content.p2: Asso imposes equivalent security and confidentiality requirements on its sub-processors.

content.p1: Asso supports the association with data subject requests and incident notifications.
content.p2: At the end of the contract, data is either returned or securely deleted according to the association's decision.
